parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To pain, grieve, vex. From lupe; to distress; reflexively or passively, to be sad.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
From an obsolete primary noun; 'ever, 'by qualification regularly; by implication, earnestly.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A primary verb; to be 'cheer'ful, i.e. Calmly happy or well-off; impersonally, especially as salutation, be well.
Poor, destitute, spiritually poor, either in a good sense (humble devout persons) or bad.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To make rich, cause to abound in, enrich. From ploutos; to make wealthy.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From kata and echo; to hold down, in various applications.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
